item.title: Tesla Taps Retail Investors for Stage-Managed Robotaxi Launch
item.description: Tesla Inc. rolled out its long-promised driverless taxi service to a handful of riders Sunday, a modest debut for what Elon Musk sees as a transformative new business line.
item.dc:creator: Kara Carlson

media:content.media:description: A Tesla robotaxi vehicle in Austin on June 22.

item.title: US Clean-Energy Project Cancellations Hit GOP Districts Hardest
item.description: Clean energy investments in the US are shrinking fast amid the rollback of tax incentives and policy uncertainties under President Donald Trump’s administration, with Republican districts hardest hit.
item.dc:creator: Tope Alake

item.title: Sanhua Slips in Hong Kong Debut After $1.2 Billion Listing
item.description: Zhejiang Sanhua Intelligent Controls Co., the Chinese maker of fridge parts that’s working on becoming a cutting-edge robotics company, edged lower during its Hong Kong trading debut after its HK$9.3 billion ($1.2 billion) stock offering.
item.dc:creator: Charlie Zhu, Kelly Li, Jing Jin

media:content.media:description: A wine fridge stands inside the kitchen area of a microflat in Hong Kong, China, on Monday, May 13, 2019. Hong Kong property, with its sky-high prices, is beyond reach of many buyers. One solution of sorts: Build smaller apartments. Photographer: Justin Chin/Bloomberg

item.title: Prosus Reports First Profit Under CEO Bloisi’s New Strategy
item.description: Technology investor Prosus NV swung into profit for the first time, as it switches strategy under Chief Executive Officer Fabricio Bloisi.
item.dc:creator: Loni Prinsloo

media:content.media:description: Fabricio Bloisi, chief executive officer of Prosus NV, following a Bloomberg Television interview at the World Economic Forum (WEF) in Davos, Switzerland, on Thursday, Jan. 23, 2025. The annual Davos gathering of political leaders, top executives and celebrities runs from January 20 to 24.

item.title: The Secretive Chinese Chip Giant That Could Be Nvidia's Biggest Threat
item.description: How Huawei became China's most powerful company.
item.dc:creator: Tracy Alloway, Joe Weisenthal

media:content.media:description: People inside a Huawei Technologies Co. store in Beijing.

item.title: Odd Lots: How Huawei Became Nvidia’s Biggest Threat (Podcast)
item.description: Right now, Nvidia stock is back near its all-time highs, thanks to seemingly unquenchable demand for its AI chips. When it comes to profiting off of this boom, Nvidia’s lead and lock-in looks almost unassailable. But there is one particular company that is clearly on the mind of CEO Jensen Huang, and that is Huawei. On this episode, we speak with Washington Post reporter Eva Dou, the author of the new book House of Huawei: The Secret History of China’s Most Powerful Company. Her book explains ho
item.dc:creator: Tracy Alloway, Joe Weisenthal

item.title: Range Intelligent Is Said to Explore Second Listing in Hong Kong
item.description: Range Intelligent Computing Technology Group Co., a Chinese data center business services provider, is considering a second listing in Hong Kong, according to people familiar with the matter.
item.dc:creator: Pei Li, Julia Fioretti

item.title: Uber Drivers Are Now More Concerned About Charging Than EV Cost
item.description: ‘We’ve got to get to work,’ the company’s head of electrification says.
item.dc:creator: Craig Trudell, Natalie Lung

media:content.media:description: Uber signage during a product unveiling event in New York, US, on Wednesday, May 14, 2025. Uber Technologies Inc. introduced a cheaper pooled rides option and a price-lock pass for commuters, underscoring its focus on attracting more daily users as consumers confront rising costs.

item.title: Montage Is Said to Hire Banks for $1 Billion Hong Kong Listing
item.description: Chinese chip designer Montage Technology Co. has hired banks for its planned Hong Kong listing that could raise about $1 billion, according to people familiar with the matter.
item.dc:creator: Julia Fioretti

item.title: Jony Ive Deal Removed From OpenAI Site Over Trademark Suit
item.description: Marketing materials and video related to a blockbuster partnership between former Apple Inc. designer Jony Ive and OpenAI Inc. were removed from the web due to a trademark dispute.
item.dc:creator: Mark Gurman

media:content.media:description: BEVERLY HILLS, CALIFORNIA - SEPTEMBER 07: (L-R) Kara Swisher, Jony Ive, and Laurene Powell Jobs speak onstage during Vox Media's 2022 Code Conference - Day 2 on September 07, 2022 in Beverly Hills, California. (Photo by Jerod Harris/Getty Images for Vox Media)

item.title: Apple Seals Movie Deal With Media Mogul Peter Chernin
item.description: The producer of Ford v. Ferrari and Back in Action moves from Netflix to Apple
item.dc:creator: Lucas Shaw

media:content.media:description: Peter Chernin Photographer: Drew Angerer/Getty Images

item.title: Senate Can Keep Ban on State AI Rules in Trump Tax Bill
item.description: A Republican effort to block US states from enforcing new artificial intelligence regulations will remain in President Donald Trump’s massive tax and spending package for now, marking a win for tech companies pushing to stall and override dozens of AI safety laws across the country.
item.dc:creator: Emily Birnbaum, Steven T. Dennis

media:content.media:description: The US Capitol in Washington on June 2. Photographer: Al Drago/Bloomberg

item.title: Apple Will Need to Leave Its M&A Comfort Zone to Succeed in AI
item.description: Apple will need to make the biggest acquisition in its history to put an end to its artificial intelligence debacle. Also: Meta rolls out new Oakley smart glasses; Honor prepares a new ultrathin foldable phone; and Apple’s annual back-to-school deal gets underway.
item.dc:creator: Mark Gurman

media:content.media:description: The Apple Park campus stands in this aerial photograph taken above Cupertino, California, U.S., on Wednesday, Oct. 23, 2019. Apple Inc. will report its fourth-quarter results next week, and based on the average analyst price target for the stock, Wall Street is feeling increasingly optimistic about the iPhone maker's prospects.

item.title: Canada Says Network Devices Compromised in China-Linked Hack
item.description: Canada’s cybersecurity agency said Chinese-backed hackers were likely behind recent malicious activity targeting domestic telecommunications infrastructure, warning that three network devices registered to a Canadian company were compromised in the attacks.
item.dc:creator: Layan Odeh

item.title: Vietnam Star Tech Firm VNG Still Plans US IPO, CEO Says
item.description: Vietnam tech firm VNG Group, which delayed a US initial public offering last year, still plans an American listing at an undetermined time, Chief Executive Officer Kelly Wong said.
item.dc:creator: Nguyen Xuan Quynh

media:content.media:description: Employees from the game creation team inside the VNG Corp.'s city campus in Ho Chi Minh City, Vietnam, on Thursday, Sept. 22, 2022. VNG, Vietnam’s answer to Tencent Holdings Ltd. with games, messaging, videos and music among its services, is accelerating its international expansion, co-founder Le Hong Minh said in an interview at its headquarters in Ho Chi Minh City.
